conclusion: Analyze velocity-time graphs for displacements of cars A and B from t=0 to t=t1.
X-axis represents time (t) and y-axis represents velocity (v). Car A's velocity increases, Car B's velocity decreases.
Displacement is calculated by finding the area under the velocity-time graph.
Visually compare areas under curves for cars A and B from t=0 to t=t1.
Area under curve for Car A is greater than area under curve for Car B, so displacement for Car A is larger.
Displacements of cars A and B are not the same; displacement of Car A is greater.
